title: Olympian Libby Trickett reveals her harrowing battle with post-natal depression
text:
In May, Libby Trickett revealed she is expecting her third child just a year after the birth of her second daughter.

And on Monday, the four-time Olympic gold medallist spoke candidly about her battle with post-natal depression.

Speaking to The Women's Weekly, the 34-year-old admitted: 'I was having thoughts I'm not proud of'.

Candid: Olympian Libby Trickett (pictured with her daughter) revealed her harrowing battle with post-natal depression in a an interview with Women's Weekly published on Monday

In an extract from Beneath The Surface: A Memoir by Libby Trickett, published by the magazine, the athlete details the moment he hit 'rock bottom' and almost crashed her car on the way to a Mums and Bubs gym class.

'I have no idea how I didn't crash the car. I was screaming hysterically: 'Why does my daughter hate me?' The darkness was blinding,' she writes.

Libby admitted to Women's Weekly: 'I understand now how some women can kill their babies.'

Struggle: In an extract from Beneath The Surface: A Memoir by Libby Trickett, published by the magazine, the athlete details the moment he hit 'rock bottom' and almost crashed her car on the way to a Mums and Bubs gym class

The swimmer added that it was, 'incredibly confronting to actually realise that could've been me' and adds she now has, 'only compassion for those women.'

She admits: 'I was so bitter with the world, and so angry with Poppy.

'I felt ashamed, like this weakness had consumed me. Unless you've been through it, no one understands.'

Libby admitted to Women's Weekly: 'I understand now how some women can kill their babies. I felt ashamed, like this weakness had consumed me. Unless you've been through it, no one understands'

Libby told fans that she and her husband Luke were expecting the newest addition to their family in November.

The Olympian gave birth to her second baby daughter, Edwina Daisy Trickett, in February 2018.

Libby and her husband Luke welcomed first daughter Poppy Frances on August 31, 2015.

For confidential support call Lifeline 24-hour crisis support on: 13 11 14
description: In May, Libby Trickett revealed she is expecting her third child just a year after the birth of her second daughter.
authors: Marta Jary For Daily Mail Australia
